item.description:
Brian Tetrault

Commercial Videography for Photographers - Get up to speed with the fastest growingtrend in the industry!

Monday March 5th 2012, 7:30–9:30pm

Have you recently been intrigued by the growing trend of videography in the photography industry? In this program, commercial photographer and videographer Brian Tetrault will step you through the transition from an all digital photography workflow into a hybrid photography/videography workflow. Key topics covered will include: integrating videography into your business, essentials of getting started in videography with little or no investment (using what you may already have), best practices and techniques for creating beautiful scenes and stories, and the basics of a good post-production workflow.

Brian began his photography career shooting for high-end residential real-estate agencies and corporate architectural firms in southern California. After relocating back to Boston, he set up Brian Tetrault Productions, which offers architectural photography, multimedia production, commercial advertising and lifestyle photography, video production and editing, and digital media consulting. Brian’s passion for his craft extends beyond helping businesses market themselves through photography and multimedia. He enjoys coaching and teaching others about the art and technology of photography in private tutoring sessions and at Boston area schools, including Boston University’s Center for Digital Imaging Arts where he has also held the position of Associate Director of Photography.

 

LOCATION - note NEW address
Lens Pro to Go
130b Baker Ave. Extension,
Concord, MA 01742

Registration: 6:30–7:30pm
Program: 7:30–9:30pm

Cost: CIPNE Members, Free; Non-members, $35; Full-time Students*, $5.

 

**Students will be required to present their photo-IDs at registration.

Pre-registration is required for this program.

Click here to register (Non-members may pay by PayPal)
